h3.span: Welcome to School Town of Highland

span.style: text-align: center; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span:

Letter to 2020 Seniors/Parents Regarding Graduation
Kindergarten Registration Link - NEW
use the link above and click on ENROLL NEW STUDENT

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
span.span: Kindergarten registration online beginning April 20 at 8 a.m. Link to the parent access page will be on this website. Registration holds your place in line per the STOH transfer policy. Prior to your student being placed on a class roster, you must provide proof of residency and proof of immunizations.

span.style: font-weight: 900; font-family: Inder, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

br.br:
Pursuant to Executive Order 20-16 (4/2/20), all public school districts
shall submit a Continuous Learning Plan to the Indiana Department of
Education (IDOE).
~

a.title: Elearning info
a.style: font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; font-size: x-large;

span.style: font-family: Inder, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

p.span: Safety is one of our district's top priorities. That's why we're now using SafeSchools Alert, a tip reporting system that allows students, staff, and parents to submit safety concerns to our administration five different ways

strong.span: App: Search for SafeSchools Alert in the App Store to download for free

p.span: Easily report tips on bullying, harassment, drugs, vandalism or any safety issue you're concerned about. Tips may be submitted anonymously, too. Thanks in advance for helping to make our school community a safer place to work and learn! We appreciate your support.

br.span: The School Town of Highland did notuse a Dyslexia Intervention program duringthe 2018-19 school year.

span.span: No STOH students were identified with dyslexia
No STOH students received dyslexia interventions

during the 2018-19 school year.
